intro: Catoblastus megalocarpus, commonly known as the giant fruit-bearing plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers and distinctive, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features include palmate leaves and a woody stem with a fibrous structure. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various animals and supporting local biodiversity.
